trial_identification.studytitle: Gastrointestinal determinants of vascular risk in healthy humans
trial_identification.scientifictitle: A randomised crossover trial of the effect of adding guar gum to meals or prolonging meal duration on postprandial flow mediated dilatation in healthy humans

conditioncode.conditioncode2: Diseases of the vasculature and circulation including the lymphatic system

interventions.interventions: Each of 3 meals will be administered once, with at least 2 days between each. For 'meal 1', the mashed potato meal will be consumed over 10 min. For 'meal 2', 9g guar gum will be added to the mashed potato meal, and consumed over 10 min. For 'meal 3', the mashed potato meal will be consumed over 60 min.
interventions.comparator: Mashed potato meal without guar gum consumed within 10 min

primaryOutcome.outcome: Change in flow mediated dilatation from baseline using brachial artery ultrasound

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Breath test for measurement of gastric emptying

eligibility.exclusivecriteria: History of gastrointestinal surgery (except appendicectomy) History of cerebral haemorrhage or head trauma Hypertrophic obstructive cardiomyopathy, or aortic or mitral valve stenosis Medication which may affect gastrointestinal motor function or phosphodiesterase type 5 inhibitors (sildenafil, tadalafil, or vardenafil) Other significant illness, including epilepsy, cardiovascular or respiratory disease Evidence of drug abuse, consumption of more than 20 g alcohol on a daily basis, or smoking.

trial_design.sequence: The order of the meals will be determined by computer-generated random number

fundingsource.fundingname: National Health and Medical Research Council of Australia

ethicsAndSummary.summary: The aim of the trial is to examine the hypothesis that dietary interventions, which slow gastric emptying and/or the rate of carbohydrate absorption, will be associated with a corresponding reduction in the decline in endothelial dysfunction that is observed after meals. Subjects will be studied on 3 occasions in random order, after an overnight fast. They will consume a 13C-octanoic acid labelled mashed potato meal ('meal 1'), or the same meal mixed with 9 g guar ('meal 2') within 10 min, or 'meal 1' divided into 12 equal portions over 60 min ('meal 3'). Brachial artery flow mediated dilatation will be measured every 30 min for 120 min, breath samples will be collected to evaluate gastric emptying, and blood will be sampled to measure blood glucose and serum insulin.
